column4: guys, for a Pentium M Processor, should i compile the SMP Kernel?
But you're not going to get much more performance by using a custom kernel.
You'll get a slightly different codepath if you put "nosmp" on the command line for the generic kernel.
the thing is, i need to compile a new kernel, to patch some drivers
Kernel options go in the /boot/grub/menu.lst file.  Look for the kopt= lines.
i want to patch the broadcom wifi driver, so it allows injection with aircrack-ng
Search for a tutorial at ubuntuforums.org to do this with "DKMS".
You can get the desired driver change without recompiling a custom kernel.  (I think.)

can i make a new grub option just to test the nosmp option?
To try it, reboot, and push <esc> at the grub prompt.  Then use the 'e'ditor to add it to the kernel line.
Don't actually change menu.lst until you're done testing different options.
